text: 3 John
Greeting
The elder, to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in \add the\add* truth.
Dear friend, I pray you may prosper concerning everything and be healthy, just as your soul prospers.

For I rejoiced exceedingly \add when the\add*\ef + \fr 1:3 \ft ﻿*Here “\add when\add*” is supplied as a component of the participle (“came”) which is understood as temporal \ef* brothers came and testified \add to\add* your truth, just as you are walking in \add the\add* truth.
I have no greater joy than this: that I hear my children are walking in the truth.
Instructions to Gaius

Dear friend, you act faithfully\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Or “you act loyally” \f* \add in\add* whatever you do for the brothers, ⸤even though they are strangers⸥\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “and this strangers” \f*.
They have testified \add to\add* your love before the church; you will do well to send them\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Literally “whom” \f* on their way in a manner worthy of God.
For they have gone out on behalf of the name, accepting nothing from the pagans.\f + \fr 1:7 \ft That is, Gentile unbelievers (as opposed to Gentile Christians) \f*
Therefore we ought to support such \add people\add*, so that we become fellow workers with \add the\add* truth.
Diotrephes Causes Trouble
I wrote something to the church, but Diotrephes, who wants to be first \add among\add* them, does not acknowledge us.

Therefore, if I come, I will call attention to ⸤the deeds he is doing⸥\f + \fr 1:10 \ft Literally “his deeds which he is doing” \f*, disparaging us with evil words. And not being content with these, he does not receive the brothers himself, and he hinders those wanting \add to do so\add* and throws \add them\add* out of the church.
Dear friend, do not imitate \add what is\add* evil, but \add what is\add* good. The one who does good is of God; the one who does evil has not seen God.
Demetrius Commended
Demetrius has been testified to by all, even by the truth itself. And we also testify \add to him\add*, and you know that our testimony is true.
Conclusion and Final Greeting
I have many things to write to you, but I do not want to write to you by means of ink and pen.
But I hope to see you right away, and to speak ⸤face to face⸥\f + \fr 1:14 \ft Literally “mouth to mouth” \f*.
Peace \add be\add* to you. The friends greet you. Greet the friends by name.
